availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sillia “Seely” Morris. Father of Emy Morris and John Morris. Farmer in Carter County in 1860. Employed Washin Patten as a farmhand in Carter County in 1860. Served in the 22nd Kentucky Infantry as private from January 19, 1862. Transferred to the Invalid Corps.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District 1, p. 252A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 197.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, Precinct 2, p. 108A.
Find A Grave, "B. T. Morris (unknown-unknown)," Memorial 50964469, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/50964469 (accessed February 4, 2020).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 110-11.
